comments.body: Do we know when BotoCoreError occurs rather than ClientError? I think I've only experience ClientError when providing invalid credentials.

BotoCoreError covers ParamValidationError and NoCredentialsError

```
In [13]: inspect.getclasstree(inspect.getmro(botocore.exceptions.NoCredentialsError))
Out[13]: 
[(object, ()),
 [(BaseException, (object,)),
  [(Exception, (BaseException,)),
   [(botocore.exceptions.BotoCoreError, (Exception,)),
    [(botocore.exceptions.NoCredentialsError,
      (botocore.exceptions.BotoCoreError,))]]]]]
```

NoCredentialsError is what happens if you call any API method (e.g. client.describe_instances) without the credentials being properly passed (i.e. passing no values, rather than passing incorrect values)

With no default profile, the latter suffices to generate a NoCredentialsError:

```
import botocore
client = boto3.session.Session().client('ec2', region_name='ap-southeast-2')
client.describe_instances()
```
